PresentingProblem.presentingProblem: Lost employment due to company closure; requests livelihood support and referral for temporary work.

BackgroundInfo.backgroundInfo: Works as daily-paid construction worker for past 6 years. Recently laid off; family depends on his earnings.

CommunityInfo.communityInfo: Barangay livelihood officer informed; possible inclusion in skilling program.

Assessment.assessment: Household income insufficient; immediate referral to livelihood program and short-term cash support recommended.

Recommendation.recommendation: Refer to livelihood training and temporary cash assistance. Assign social worker for follow-up.

PresentingProblem2.presentingProblem: Mother also lost identification documents and household goods in the fire and needs support to recover IDs and immediate items.

BackgroundInfo2.backgroundInfo: Elderly mother relies on son's income; has limited mobility and lost important documents during incident.

CommunityInfo2.communityInfo: Barangay relief committee arranged temporary food packs and will assist with ID replacement process.

Assessment2.assessment: Secondary household member (mother) has vulnerabilities: elderly, no steady income—recommend cash for IDs and transport assistance.

Recommendation2.recommendation: Assist mother with civil registry for replacement IDs, provide transport subsidy, and include her in monitoring visits.

PresentingProblem.presentingProblem: Child frequently absent from school, signs of neglect and bruises observed; school reported concerns.

BackgroundInfo.backgroundInfo: Household with intermittent income; caregiver stressed; history of alcohol use by father reported.

CommunityInfo.communityInfo: School and barangay social worker engaged; family monitored.

Assessment.assessment: High risk for neglect. Protective interventions and coordinated support with education and barangay recommended.

Recommendation.recommendation: Open protective case, assign social worker, coordinate with school and barangay; consider temporary alternative care if risk escalates.

PresentingProblem2.presentingProblem: Child shows signs of neglect and physical marks; additional protective needs for schooling and counseling.

BackgroundInfo2.backgroundInfo: Mother struggles with income; father has periods of absence and alcohol use; home environment unstable.

CommunityInfo2.communityInfo: School guidance counselor and barangay SW monitor; referrals to child protection committee made.

Assessment2.assessment: Child requires protective plan, coordination with education, and monitoring of caregiver capacity.

Recommendation2.recommendation: Immediate referral to child protection, regular monitoring visits, enroll child support services and consider temporary alternative care if situation worsens.

PresentingProblem.presentingProblem: Marital conflict affecting family functioning; request for counseling and mediation.

BackgroundInfo.backgroundInfo: History of disagreements over finances; no reported physical violence.

CommunityInfo.communityInfo: Barangay mediation services aware and willing to assist.

Assessment.assessment: Low-to-moderate risk. Family mediation and counseling appropriate.

Recommendation.recommendation: Refer to family counselor and schedule mediation sessions. Monitor progress.

PresentingProblem2.presentingProblem: Child exposed to parental conflict; requires monitoring and emotional support.

BackgroundInfo2.backgroundInfo: Parents experiencing financial stress leading to frequent arguments; child reports anxiety at school.

CommunityInfo2.communityInfo: Barangay mediation and school counselor aware; child support services advised.

Assessment2.assessment: Child may benefit from counseling and parenting support for caregivers.

Recommendation2.recommendation: Provide family counseling, refer child to school guidance, and include in follow-up visits.

PresentingProblem.presentingProblem: Referred for follow-up care after minor surgery; requires support for medication and transport.

BackgroundInfo.backgroundInfo: Underwent minor procedure; limited funds for follow-up.

CommunityInfo.communityInfo: Health center provided initial assistance; no further community issues reported.

Assessment.assessment: Low urgency. Provide one-time transport subsidy and medication support.

Recommendation.recommendation: Provide transport cost and medication referral; case closed after confirmation of receipt.

PresentingProblem2.presentingProblem: Elder family member requires follow-up care arrangements; transport support requested.

BackgroundInfo2.backgroundInfo: Family recovering from surgery; limited cash for medications and travel.

CommunityInfo2.communityInfo: Health center and barangay notified; volunteer drivers available.

Assessment2.assessment: Low priority; provide transport subsidy and confirm medication adherence.

Recommendation2.recommendation: Provide transport and medication referrals; close once receipt confirmed.

PresentingProblem.presentingProblem: Business affected by recent flooding; requests business recovery assistance and guidance on accessing small loans.

BackgroundInfo.backgroundInfo: Owner of sari-sari store impacted by natural disaster; stock damaged.

CommunityInfo.communityInfo: Barangay disaster response team engaged; available microfinance referral options.

Assessment.assessment: Medium priority for economic recovery support. Recommend linkage to microfinance and temporary livelihood grant.

Recommendation.recommendation: Refer to microfinance partner and provide short-term livelihood support. Assign case manager for follow-up.

PresentingProblem2.presentingProblem: Children affected by flooding; need psycho-social support and school re-enrollment assistance.

BackgroundInfo2.backgroundInfo: Flood damaged home and inventory; children out of school for two weeks.

CommunityInfo2.communityInfo: Disaster response team identified temporary market stalls and cash-for-work opportunities.

Assessment2.assessment: Family needs livelihood and education support; prioritize child's psychosocial care.

Recommendation2.recommendation: Link family to livelihood grants, coordinate with school for catch-up classes, and schedule psychosocial sessions for child.
